definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: The party will start at seven-thirty.
sentences.chinese: 庆生会将在七点半开始。

sentences.english: Did you have a good time at the party this afternoon?
sentences.chinese: 下午的庆生会玩得好开心。

sentences.english: Many friends will go to Tom’s birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 很多朋友将参加汤姆的庆生会。

sentences.english: Jade love he, his sister-in-law birthday party still unrepentant.
sentences.chinese: 玉卿嫂苦求庆生，他仍无悔意。

sentences.english: ChengKang want to purple Qian birthday, purple Qian intentionally avoid the topic.
sentences.chinese: 承康想为紫芊庆生，紫芊故意避开话题。

sentences.english: In the film, the Zhu Qingsheng of Zheng Hao personate is an average miner.
sentences.chinese: 电影中，郑昊饰演的朱庆生是一位普通的矿工。

sentences.english: Many friends will go to Tom's birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 很多朋友将参加汤姆的庆生会。

sentences.english: My wife happened to have a chance to go to one of his colleagues' son's birth celebration party.
sentences.chinese: 我爱人碰巧要去参加一位同事的儿子的庆生聚会。

sentences.english: The seal I received today for my birthday was carved by disciple Wang Hao.
sentences.chinese: 今天收到的这枚为我庆生的印是弟子王浩刻的。

sentences.english: A man wanted to celebrate his wife's Birthday by throwing a party.
sentences.chinese: 有位先生想为他老婆举办一个庆生派对。

sentences.english: On Saturday morning, Tom will clean his apartment.
sentences.chinese: 朋友将参加汤姆的庆生会。

sentences.english: They celebrate their birthdays on February 28th or March 1st during non-leap years.
sentences.chinese: 非闰年时，他们会在二月二十八日或三月一日庆生。

sentences.english: High a buffet with mother birthday, invited Ai go with jade-like stone.
sentences.chinese: 高凡与母亲吃自助餐庆生，邀皑莹同往。

sentences.english: It was my idea to invite so many people to her birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 请这么多人来参加她的庆生会是我出的主意。

sentences.english: Tamara and Phil are planning a birthday party for their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 泰玛拉和菲尔计划为他们的女儿开一个庆生会。

sentences.english: This time, he has chosen Hong Kong to hold the Birthday Celebration.
sentences.chinese: 这次他选择了到香港举行千人亚洲庆生的活动。

definition: to check on sb at his workplace/to come to a movie set to visit one of the actors
child whose birthday is being celebrated/birthday boy/birthday girl
to take a joint photo/group photo
(slang) to cheer sb on/to show one's support/("call" is pronounced approximately like English "call")
to see someone off/to throw someone a send-off party
to cheer on (originally esp. as paid stooge)/to root for sb/to sing sb's praises/to flatter
to celebrate a birthday/to give a birthday party
(originally) to provide assistance/(more recently) to show one's support (for a singing idol etc)
